lead_paragraph: A question has long hung over Celebrex: Did it cause heart attacks? Now, a clinical trial suggests it may be safer than drugs like ibuprofen and naproxen.

headline.print_headline: Celebrex Is Found to Be No Riskier for Hearts Than Other Pain Drugs
headline.main: Celebrex Is Found to Be No Riskier for Hearts Than Other Pain Drugs

snippet: A question has long hung over Celebrex: Did it cause heart attacks? Now, a clinical trial suggests it may be safer than drugs like ibuprofen and naproxen....
abstract: Pfizer-funded study by Dr Steven Nissen of Cleveland Clinic published in New England Journal of Medicine indicates prescription-only, anti-inflammatory medication celecoxib is safer for patients with heart problems than naproxen or ibuprofen; decade-long research involved 24,000 patients with arthritis who had or were at high risk for heart disease; findings may increase prescriptions of celecoxib for long-term use because it does not appear to cause gastrointestinal bleeding.
